intro: Impatiens eubotrya, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, with upright stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Impatiens eubotrya is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
